intro: Lasianthus langkokensis, commonly known as the Klangkong tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
